intro: Rolfea powellii, commonly known as Powell's rolfea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sorrels. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Rolfea powellii is adapted to arid environments and is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
